question: What was the statutory cash reserves requirement originally when the Banking regulations Act was passed in 1949?
option1: 2% of demand liabilities and 5% of time liabilities
option2: 5% of demand liabilities and 2% of time liabilities
option3: 5% of demand liabilities and 5% of time liabilities
option4: 5% of demand liabilities and 5% of time liabilities
answer: 5% of demand liabilities and 2% of time liabilities
explanation: Earlier, (originally in the BR act) the statutory cash reserves requirement with the RBI was as follows â€“ 5% of demand liabilities and 2% of time liabilities. But now it is the portion of Net Demand and Time Liabilities (NDTL).
